thread.title: Phillipsburg football team drops a 'goose egg' on Elizabeth
thread.title_full: Phillipsburg football team drops a 'goose egg' on Elizabeth

title: Phillipsburg football team drops a 'goose egg' on Elizabeth
text:
Jim Marinelli (lehighvalleylive.com file photo) 
The ‘Bronco Front’ may not be a household name to most football enthusiasts. 
However, it really payed dividends for Phillipsburg High School’s defense on Friday night. 
“The new ‘Bronco Front’ worked great,” defensive tackle Jim Marinelli said after the Stateliners blanked Elizabeth 31-0 in a Mid-State 38 Conference Delaware Division football game at Maloney Stadium. 
P’burg defensive coordinator Frank Duffy is essentially responsible for installing the ‘Bronco Front.’ And his players carried out the plan very effectively. 
“Personally, I love the ‘Bronco Front,”’ said Marinelli, who is also P’burg’s starting center. “I just did my job, and I love my job.” 
Marinelli received plenty of help from fellow defensive linemen Matt Yanes, Robert Melise and Zach Troxell. Defensive backs Manny Romero , Ja’Quan Jones and Jayshawn Grant all intercepted Franklin quarterback Pernell Williams. 
RELATED : Phillipsburg QB Zach Ringhoff out indefinitely with a broken thumb 
“Frank (Duffy) did a great job all week,” said P’burg coach Ryan Ditze, whose team improved to 4-1. “We had great schemes. Guys were running to the football. We’ve improved defensively, which is great to see. I think our defense has caught up to our offense, and that’s going to make us a very good team.” 
Field position played a big part as Elizabeth (3-2) was constantly pinned deep in its own territory. 
“I don’t think they started any drives outside the 20,” Ditze said. “Brendan Grube (who kicks off) did a great job kicking the ball. And it was great coverage by the kids.” 
The shutout was P’burg’s first since a 33-0 win over Mendham in last year’s NJSIAA North 2 Group 4 playoffs. But it didn’t come easily. Elizabeth penetrated to P’burg’s 25 late in the second quarter before Marinelli and Troxell combined to sack Williams to end the drive. 
Elizabeth was on P’burg’s 12 early in the fourth quarter when Williams was intercepted by Ja’Quan Jones, who proceeded to run it back 65 yards to set up a 27-yard field goal by Grube. 
“As a senior, it’s great to get that first goose egg at home,” Marinelli said. “It’s amazing to get a shutout in front of the student section and fans we have.” 
Tom Hinkel may be reached at thinkel@lehighvalleylive.com . Follow him on Twitter @TomHinkelLV . Find Lehigh Valley high school sports on Facebook
